parameters: bg_black
bg_riverbankalt
<Teizoku> (“We are all relying on you!” Mako said)
<Teizoku> (I’m stressed out. I don’t like being
forced into this role.)
<Teizoku> (I love taking these pictures, this
shining river, the waning moon)
<Teizoku> (But I love these pictures because I take
them, for me. Not for them, or anybody else.)
<Teizoku> (I didn’t want the competition money that
Mako gave to me after she submitted my photos,
because you can’t buy beauty like this.)
<Teizoku> (You can only experience it. And its essence
is lost when beauty is translated into money. That
makes me sad, why did Mako do that behind my back?)
<Teizoku> (Mako used to not be this pushy, I know she
does it because she thinks it’s the best for me, but
it still feels terrible.)
<Teizoku> (Yako...)
<Teizoku> (I like Yako, she’s a good girl, a kind
person. Now why should the president and Principal be
able to see her in her most special moments? They
don’t deserve it, they don’t even care about her.)
<Teizoku> (All they care about is their reputation and
career. How can I ask Yako to let me take her picture
when I know the disingenuous ends it will serve?)
<Teizoku> (Even if she is happy for me to take it, what
if she gets fired for breaking the cafe rules once the
photos are out?)
<Teizoku> (I don’t want to deceive Yako. And even if
she’s okay with being published, even if the cafe
doesn’t fire her, isn’t it still wrong?)
<Teizoku> (The school doesn’t understand her beauty
here, all it understands is its own self-interest.)
<Teizoku> (I have been pushed into this situation,
with the threat of my own future looming over my head,
but what even is that threat?)
<Teizoku> (I don’t even know if I want to be a career
photographer and go to the sister University, and
despite that they’re making me feel desperate about
an outcome I don’t even know I want.)
<Teizoku> (I like Yako, I want to treat her right.
But how can I treat her right if I give her picture
for the sake of the school?)
<Teizoku> (How can that be okay? Is it possible for
that to be okay? Can I find a way to make that okay
somehow?)
<Teizoku> Bah, taking pictures tonight is quite
stressful. Well, I do have a lot going on.
<Teizoku> Maybe I should talk to Mako about some of
this tomorrow, even if she’s meaner now she is still
my childhood friend, I should still be able to talk
to her.
Teizoku left the river and headed home.
A
bg_riversuicidealt
<Teizoku> (...)
<Teizoku> (...)
<Teizoku> (...)
<Teizoku> (...)
Teizoku sat down on the riverbank, exhausted.
Teizoku let out one dejected laugh.
<Teizoku> (What is all of this? Is all of this some
cruel, unbearable joke that I don’t understand?)
<Teizoku> (I didn’t even mean to say what I said with
Mako, but it just slipped out, and wouldn’t stop
coming out until it was all splattered there on the
ground.)
<Teizoku> When did Mako become a psychopath? You can’t
respond to what I said with cynicism unless you are
not human.)
<Teizoku> (And the situation is unchanged, if not even
worse, because Mako will never compromise and I either
comply with her or lose everything. Is this a joke?)
<Teizoku> (The commission moved the deadline, and Yako
herself wants me to take her picture the next time I
am there. I am not ready for any of this!)
<Teizoku> (I’m by myself here on the bank, no one
can be with me here right now.)
<Teizoku> (Either you are heartless or ignorant, and I
am stuck inbetween being forced to choose either of
the one.)
<Teizoku> (But I don’t want my limbs to be torn to
pieces like they are being pulled now, it’s not okay.
It’s not okay.)
<Teizoku> (Jin said he took those needles to calm
himself, but he was never clear about the reason.)
<Teizoku> (Well, if I had needles in front of me now I
might just take them. It won’t solve the situation,
but I won’t have to boil underneath my own skin alive
like I am now. So I can’t judge Jin.)
Teizoku flipped through his photos.
<Teizoku> (My photos are not so good today. This last
one of the bridge almost looks like a demon is
standing on top of it, ready to jump off and kill me.)
<Teizoku> (...)
<Teizoku> (Hmm, this figure is kind of strange now
that I look at it.)
Teizoku brought up his camera and looked through the
lens zooming in at the shadow on the bridge.
<Teizoku> (It looks like a shadowy figure, it’s still
there but I can’t make it out.)
Teizoku snapped a photo, the flash illuminating the
figure.
The shadow, after being flashed, started wobbling,
lost balance, and fell off the bridge into the river
below. Splash.
<Teizoku> (Oh fuck! It wasn’t a demon, it was a
person! They fell in!)
Teizoku left his camera on the ground and ran to the
river, jumping over the railing.
Splash! The water was icy cold under the November
winds, but Teizoku paddled on breathlessly towards
the figure. The figure was flailing wildly and clearly
not a pro swimmer.
<Teizoku> (Don’t go under yet! I’m almost there! Stay
above water!)
The figure started to sink like a rock beneath the dim
moonlight as Teizoku barely reached it in time to grab
on.
<Teizoku> (Got you!)
But the figure also grabbed onto Teizoku as well,
pulling him aggressively under.
<Teizoku> (Ack!!)
Teizoku and the figure flailed chaotically underwater
together, as each fought for topside air. In the midst
of their struggle, Teizoku was elbowed hard in the face
and lost consciousness.
The world went black.
bg_mountains
Then all was light.
Teizoku was standing on some clouds somewhere, high
above the earth. There was a being next to him that
he could not see but only feel. Lotus petals floated
all around them.
<Teizoku> (Where am I?)
<...> You are here, and you’ve always been here.
<Teizoku> (I’m drowning! What the fuck! Get me out of
here!)
<...> You are ascending. Have peace, feel the
tranquility.
bg_riverswim4
<Teizoku> (Fuck this near-death experience bullshit!
Get away from the light! Get away! Aieee!!)
<...> Okay. As you wish.
bg_riverswim2
<Teizoku> Ahhhh!!!
Teizoku snapped back to reality. He broke away from
the figure who was pushing and leaning on Teizoku
underwater to stay above and breathe, and the moment
he got away the figure started to sink and flail again.
<Teizoku> (Oh no you don’t!)
Teizoku dived back down into the water, and managed to
hug the figure by its back and drag it up towards the
surface. Their heads broke into the chilly air above.
<Teizoku> Stop flailing!
Teizoku kicked as hard as he could towards the shore,
supporting both of them with each stroke of his leg.
His legs were on fire from the exertion. It started to
give way, and his energies started to tremble.
<Teizoku> This is the worse fucking day of my life!
Fuck this bullshit! Fuck Mako, fuck the Principal,
fuck Jin, fuck this competition, fuck drowning, fuck
all of this! Fuck everything! Ahhhh!!!!
A surge of adrenaline shot up through his veins,
invigorating his heart and legs, and Teizoku was
needing energy no more. His tiredness left him and he
could kick easily and steadily.
<???> Hehehe.
<Teizoku> Why are you laughing!!!? You drowning! Be
quiet as I save us!! Aghblaurh-
bg_wetriverbank
Teizoku caught some water from opening his mouth,
and stopped kicking to cough it out, and then he
resumed. He decided to shut up until they were on
land.
Maiya11
Teizoku and the person made it back to shore, they
sat on the bank to catch their breathing and steady
their drumming hearts.
Teizoku was spent, but his adrenaline prevented him
from feeling how tired he was at that moment. All that
he felt was panic and indignation at life.
<???> Thank you my angry hero. You aren’t a half-bad
swimmer.
<Teizoku> Hmm??
Through the small moonlight and the reflections off
the streetlamp, Teizoku looked at the figure. It was a
skinny girl, with silver hair wearing a dark sundress
that clung wetly to her body.
She had an ambivalent smile on her face with a rosy
complexion and was slightly shivering.
Maiya12
<???> Hehe, sorry for nearly drowning you too, but you
were a great pool-float when I needed air.
Maiya13
<Teizoku> And you were like quick-sand that kept
dragging me under.
<???> Ahh? It wasn’t so bad was it? You get to
experience life in a totally different way for a few
moments.
<Teizoku> Heh, easy for you to say. You get to be
carried like a brick as I pull us out of the ice.
You elbowed me and I lost consciousness, if I didn’t
wake up we would both be at the bottom of the river.
Maiya14
<???> Isn’t that dark? Thank you for your hard work,
what is the name of my savior?
Maiya11
<Teizoku> My name is Teizoku.
<???> Teizoku, that’s a curious name. I am Maiya,
Maiya Shinoda.
<Teizoku> Why do you sound familiar?
Maiya14
<Maiya> I am the lead singer of the rock-band enmity
love.
<Teizoku> Ah! My friend likes your band!
<Maiya> Is that so.
The cold November winds sprinted past their wet bodies
in a devilish gust.
<Maiya> Shall we go get a drink and warm up?
<Teizoku> ...Alright let’s go warm up.
Teizoku went and picked up his camera and they both
walked down the sidewalk.
A
bg_black
bg_riversuicidealt
That night, Teizoku returned to the location by the
bridge.
Instead of taking pictures of the river and water, he
turned towards the houses, and immediately saw one
strikingly decrepit alleyway wedged between two of
them.
<Teizoku> (That’s gotta be it, what Maiya was
referring to.)
He got up the entrance and looked at the alleyway.
Light seemingly could not penetrate into the alley, the
darkness was so thick it was almost alive and exuding
out into the main-street like a viscous tendril, a
solid blob of all-encompassing nothingness.
Light seemed to be sucked into it like a void without
distance.
Something energetically felt ominous and cursed down
that valley, and Teizoku could sense it down his bones,
something that must not be touched or seen.
But he stepped forward into the unquiet darkness
regardless, and walked at his pace, for his resolve
burned brightly in his heart.
A heaviness clung all around Teizoku, as if the dark
particles clung onto his skin weighing him down, and
a very low buzzing and humming was heard all around.
The further he walked, the further the heaviness
became, and the louder the humming droned.
He kept walking until at last, the drumming was almost
a roaring, and the heaviness around him was nearly
unbearable.
A figure appeared before Teizoku. A naked bald head,
with a grinning face without eyes, was floating in the
darkness.
Despite no light being found anywhere, Teizoku could
perfectly see the pale cracked skin framing the toothy
grin of the figure as he walked towards it.
Teizoku looked at the head without looking away, and
the head was gazing back at him.
<???> Speeeak, speeaak, or you shall be feasted upon
and lost here.
<Teizoku> Oh figure of the alley, I have been told to
seek here the truth of this night, the final truth of
my task, that I could not see during the first time
through.
<???> You would saaaay that to me? The figure of the
alleyway? If you so dare as you say then put me onto
your face.
The head turned itself around from Teizoku and exposed
its back.
It was a mask, and could be worn, but inside the
cavity of the mask there wriggled many millipedes
and cockroaches and 4 rusty but sharp needles poking
out.
<???> Nooow do youuu still daaare to put me ooon? Will
you run awaaay, out of this valley, and into the world?
Teizoku strode up to the figure, grabbed it with both
hands, and placed it unto his face as a reply.
The wriggling insects protested against his eyeballs
and lips and nose, and some wormed their way in, as the
four needles stabbed into the skin of Teizoku’s cheeks,
blood dripping down all four puncture points, but
Teizoku with an involuntary grimace persevered onwards
and pushed the mask and the needles and the cockroaches
fully in until Teizoku could gaze out of the mask
as if it were his own eyeballs. Blood drained down the
mask and down his neck.
<???> Hahahahaha!!
Peering out of the Mask, Teizoku saw somebody he did
not see before. A tall lanky man in a pin-stripe suit,
with old eyes and thick eyebrows. He seemed to have
been following Teizoku for a long time.
<Teizoku> (Who are you?)
<???> I am the third possibility, one that you did not
wish to see, the one that could’ve happened in reality.
<Teizoku> (Then what are you? I’m here right now,
speaking from the darkness of this alley to you. I’ve
come to seek you out, help me understand.)
<???> Very very simple, for the task of the picture
and school, you could have had both honesty and
dishonesty, and could have had everything.
<Teizoku> What do you mean?
<???> You already know what I mean, you just didn’t
let yourself see it. Very simply, you care deeply about
truth and justice, and you also care about Mako and
the school,
<???> you needed to give each thing what they
demanded. Give unto truth what is for truth, and give
unto falsehoods what is for falsehoods.
<Teizoku> (I don’t understand.)
<???> You could have just lied to the school,
fabricate your own bullshit cafe scene, have someone
else who already is a public figure wear Yako’s maid
costume, and taken that picture.
<???> You’re good enough of a photographer to
manufacture convincing enough bullshit that the common
media cannot tell any difference, and in that way you
would have also protected Yako and your integrity.
<???> If you feel you’ve still been wronged by Mako
for being gaslit into the situation, then you may find
another way later to get back at her,
<???> but that situation was not the end of the world
and you could’ve survived it with everything intact.
<Teizoku> Yeah I could have done that, but I would
have to lie and I don’t like lying.
<???> It is not lying if it is for the sake of
protecting the truth.
<Teizoku> I’m not sure if I agree with what you are
telling me.
<???> Well obviously, you never even considered me for
a moment leading up to this. Do you know why you didn’t
consider this option?
<???> Why, even though it’s fairly obvious, this
solution never crossed your conscious mind for a
single moment? It’s not because you value truth, it’s
because you wanted self-destructive vindication.
<???> That’s the truth.
<???> You wanted to drag all of your wrong-doers down
with you in a flaming kamikaze of destructiveness and
revenge. Harm Mako, the Principal, and the school as
well?
<???> They deserve that, they deserve to suffer and
deal with all of their consequences too, it wasn’t
merely for truth, wasn’t merely just for the sake of
honesty,
<???> revenge was the real thriving desire and
motivation that you could never even admit to yourself.
<???> So that’s why no one understood you, you didn’t
understand yourself. Even Maiya couldn’t reach you
here, she only pushed you upwards for ascension,
<???> but could not touch down the depths and dirt of
your true motivations. It was only you yourself who
had to come here in the dreary maggot-filled darkness
to see this,
<???> the final possibility that only manifests if you
see your own hateful destructiveness.
<???> Fundamentally you were possessed by
vindictiveness, and that vindictiveness mixed in
together with your genuine value and desire for truth,
but truth then became a puppet to your vindication.
<???> You were performing truth for vindication’s sake
primarily and only secondarily did you do it for
truth’s own sake.
<???> Just like Mako said that you and her and the
Principal were all alike. She didn’t intend this, but
that was completely accurate:
<???> Mako was using integrity and “the greater good”
as a tool for her selfish gains, and you were using
truth and integrity as a tool for your
self-destructive revenge.
<???> But what you did do, choosing ascension and Yako
and integrity over blackmail, that was still the action
towards truth, so you had the happiest version of that
type of dualistic conflict,
<???> but the conflict was never dualism in the first
place, it was neither this or that, you could’ve
stepped outside of either/or if you would only have
stepped outside of your need for revenge.
<???> But you could not see this, and that drive made
the conflicts irreconcilable, because you were
possessed by it.
The four needles turned like screws into Teizoku’s
face, locking permanently on so that Teizoku could not
tell his skin from the cracked porcelain apart. The
darkness no longer drummed on but was still.
<???> Now you are possessed no longer, now nothing
floats in the dark of your mind. Do you mourn?
<Teizoku> I am exhausted, that’s all I feel. I’ve
mourned already, given up myself already, and I do
see it now, and I am tired and dejected.
<???> Then that is the good and healing dejection.
<Teizoku> So it is.
<???> Do you accept the whispering of this old man and
the mask of the alley as your own flesh?
<Teizoku> Yes. I accept the truth of this alleyway.
<???> Then what’s done is done. This world is
temporary, and is unstable, and will now collapse,
it’s only purpose was for you to see and become aware.
<???> This timeline is not real, after you put the key
to your head in the backstage of the concert, you fell
into a coma for a day. Yako took you to a hospital and
is caring for you in the bed.
<???> She is holding your hand now lovingly, now it is
time for you to wake up.
<Teizoku> Would I not have been able to see what would
have happened if I chose to step outside of my anger
and face the decision differently in this timeline?
<???> You could see it, but you can’t live it. You
made your choice already, and it’s not much to see.
In that world you are happy with Yako and you are
celebrated by the school and have many options.
<???> You have your foot in both areas there, the
world of man and the world of integrity. Is that truly
a better situation than the one you actually chose?
Maybe yes, maybe not.
<???> In either event, it is not for you to know or
live.
<Teizoku> Wait a moment before I go back.
<Teizoku> Thank you.
<???> You don’t not need to thank me, you are living
the reality of gratitude by coming into the alley in
the first place.
<???> I’ve seen and acknowledged that when you didn’t
run from the mask but put it on.
Teizoku was quiet for a moment.
Teizoku breathed a long sigh.
<Teizoku> It is my life to live now huh?
<???> Yes, live it out with Yako. But you can live now
without the scratching of your hidden vindication,
you can live life and serve truth for its own sake,
and not living truth out because of unresolved spite.
<???> You are now a 1.5th degree initiate.
<Teizoku> What level of initiate is Maiya?
bg_hospitalalt
<Teizoku> Okay, I will go back now.
<???> Good.
Teizoku opened his eyes in the hospital bed. Yako was
sitting next to him caressing his fingers.
<Yako> Oh Tei-kun!! You’re finally awake!! I’ve been
so worried...
<Teizoku> Hey Yako, how many days has it been?
<Yako> One day since we went to the concert.
Teizoku reached out to Yako's face and stroked her
cheeks with his fingers.
<Teizoku> Hah, remind me not to talk to Maiya for a
very long time. I have a lot of work to do, on my own
self and on my own photography, and I want you to be
here next to me for each step of the way.
<Yako> Of course Tei-kun, I will always be here
together with you.
<Teizoku> Then let’s live our life. Come here.
Yako leaned over and Teizoku planted a kiss on her
lips.
Galv.CRED.start("Credits");
A
